In this document, we will perform analysis on the _penguins_ dataset accessed from the _palmerpenguins_ package (accessed below).


```{r}
#| warning: false
library(palmerpenguins)

# use :: to access data or functions from within a package 
penguins <- palmerpenguins::penguins
```

```{r, message=FALSE}
#| label: tbl-sex-counts
#| tbl-cap: "Number of Penguins by Sex"
sex_counts <- table(penguins$sex)
knitr::kable(sex_counts, col.names  = c("Sex", "Count"))
```

@tbl-sex-counts Shows the number of male and female penguins in the dataset.


```{r, echo=FALSE}
#| layout-ncol: 2
#| layout-nrow: 2
#| label: fig-box-whisker-plots
#| fig-pos: H
#| fig-cap: "Distributions of Features by Sex"
#| fig-subcap: 
#|   - "Bill Length Distribution"
#|   - "Bill Depth Distribution"
#|   - "Flipper Length Distribution"
#|   - "Body Mass Distribution"

plot(penguins$sex, penguins$bill_length_mm, xlab = "", ylab = "Bill Length (mm)", col = c(6,3))
abline(h = mean(penguins$bill_length_mm, na.rm = TRUE), col = 2, lwd = 2)

plot(penguins$sex, penguins$bill_depth_mm, xlab = "", ylab = "Bill Depth (mm)", col = c(6,3))
abline(h = mean(penguins$bill_depth_mm, na.rm = TRUE), col = 2, lwd = 2)

plot(penguins$sex, penguins$flipper_length_mm, xlab = "", ylab = "Flipper Length (mm)", col = c(6,3))
abline(h = mean(penguins$flipper_length_mm, na.rm = TRUE), col = 2, lwd = 2)

plot(penguins$sex, penguins$body_mass_g, xlab = "", ylab = "Body Mass (g)", col = c(6,3))
abline(h = mean(penguins$body_mass_g, na.rm = TRUE), col = 2, lwd = 2)

```



@fig-box-whisker-plots demonstrates the distribution of various features for both male and female penguins.

@penguins proposes a method for identifying the gender Otago blue penguins from bill measurements, suggesting that the variations by gender seen here may reflect real patterns.

```{r}
#| label: fig-bill-length-body-mass-scatter
#| fig-cap: "Penguin Bill Length vs Body Mass"
plot(
 x = penguins$bill_length_mm,
 y = penguins$body_mass_g,
 col = penguins$sex,
 pch = 15 + as.numeric(penguins$sex),
 xlab = "Bill Length (mm)",
 ylab = "Body Mass (g)",
 bty = "n")
 legend(
 "bottomright",
 legend = c("Female", "Male"),
 pch = 16:18,
 col = 1:3,
 bty = "n")
```

@fig-bill-length-body-mass-scatter analyses the relationship between the Bill Length and Body Mass for each sex.
